abstract: Occupy Wall Street-related protest camp at St Paul's Cathedral in London, country's most iconic religious landmark, has become subject of acrimonious debate within the Church of England; as St Paul's officials go to court to seek order to dismantle the camp, two clerics who support the movement resign in protest.
snippet: Amid a lawsuit and the resignations of two clerics, a rift has emerged in the Church of England over what to do about the protest camp outside St. Paul’s Cathedral.
lead_paragraph: Amid a lawsuit and the resignations of two clerics, a rift has emerged in the Church of England over what to do about the protest camp outside St. Paul’s Cathedral.

headline.main: ‘Occupy’ Protest at St. Paul’s Cathedral in London Divides Church
headline.print_headline: ‘Occupy’ Protest at St. Paul’s Cathedral in London Divides Church
headline.seo: ‘Occupy’ Protest at St. Paul’s Cathedral Splits Church
